sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not commutative with respect to Cartesian product.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2, 3} and B = {2, 3, 4}. Find the Cartesian product of (A ∆ B) and (B ∆ A), where ∆ denotes the symmetric difference. Show that (A ∆ B) x (B ∆ A) is not equal to (B ∆ A) x (A ∆ B).
